info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 02 at 3:59PM CDT until July 02 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL MADISON COUNTY... At 359 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over northwestern Huntsville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Huntsville, Madison, Moores Mill, Meridianville, Hazel Green, Alabama A And M University, University Of Alabama In Huntsville, Harvest, Maysville and Ryland. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Trained weather spotters have reported quarter size hail falling in Harvest and Monrovia! Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
